properties.media:imagetext:
March
Nineteenth,
1 9 2 7
Mr. Geo. A. Kneese,
County
Surveyor,
San Mateo, Calif.
My dear Mr. Kneese:
The City and County of San Francisco have leased from
the Mills
Estate a tract of land on the Bay
Lomita Park, to be used
Shore, opposite
as an air port site.
for three years with the privilege of extension for
an additional two years, and there is a possibility that this
site may be selected as a permanent air port site.
We have made arrangements with the town of San Bruno for
a fresh water supply and connection with their
system.
connection will be made on Mills Avenue within the town limits
of San Bruno, and it will be necessary to run a 3" pipe line
down San Felipe Avenue.
I am enclosing a blue print explaining
the entire construction of the line.
I understand that San Felipe Avenue is a county road and
comes within the jurisdiction of the Board
of Supervisors of
San Mateo County.
In this case I suppose it is necessary to
secure permission from the County Board of Supervisors.
there will be a convention of air men in San Francisco May 5,
6 and 7, we are anxious to have the air port ready at that time,
and we would appreciate any assistance you could render us
toward securing the privilege of laying this pipe line in San
Felipe Avenue.
Would you kindly let me know what sort of an application
we have to make, and to whom, and to what conditions we have
to agree.
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP: KH
375 City Hall.
